text: Can from Discount. Pours a deep gold with a finger of head. Light bready aromas with some honey and granola. Good carbonation, quite dry on the palate. Good mouthfeel, but a little too dry on the finish.

Can. Corn, light black pepper, barley malt, and hay aroma. Golden yellow with large off-white head. Moderately sweet toffee malt, and moderately bitter weedy hay/quinine flavor. Good body. Pretty much spot on for a Dortmunder.

Can:
Slightly hazy gold with a short, off-white head.
Aroma of grain, atouch of corn.
Taste is sweet, just a little peppery, corn.
Grain malt.
Mid grassy bittering.
Nicely bodied and solid.
Draught at Bru. Nicely done lager with some initial sweetness and then a bit of corn like taste. Golden orange.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Sample at Braxton on 2/4/17. Clear gold to amber pour with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, crisp lager yeast and some noble hops. Malty flavor with crisp lager yeast accents before a crisp noble hop finish. I could stop drinking it, but I Dont Want To.
draft. Nose is grass and a little bready. Sip adds caramel. Light to medium bitterness. Light and refreshing. 7/3/7/3/15

Draft sample. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. The aroma has a bit of grassy, corny, and a little bready character. Leans toward the bitter side, but is fairly balanced. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Draft to taster. Looks solid; a transparent deeper (borderline orangish) gold with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells solid too; smells of mild caramel and lager yeast. Tastes like it smells, but with more toffee than caramel. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied. Not bad, but forgettable.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Pours a clear golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have pale, lightly toasted bready malts, mild fruitiness, very light bitterness, decent beer for what it is, but not overly complex, I would try it again just for comparison sake.

On tap at Dutchs. Clear golden orange color. Thin off-white head. Leaves good thicker ridges and webs of lace. Good bready, mild spicy pepper, hints of orchard fruit. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of soft, mildly effervescent light carbonation. Mild slick finish. Moderate sweet taste, lighter bitter. Solid bigger dortmunder. Satisfying. Nice to enjoy with my smoked chicken sandwich.

on tap @ Braxton / Covington KY --- Clear light amber color, white head cover, curtain of lace. Taste is solid sweet malt that adds solid carbonation and mild hops on the swallow, maintaining until the finish when malt shows again for a curtain call. Well-balanced, complex, a solid Dortmunder.
Draft from the brewery tap room: yellow-gold pour with thin white head. aroma of bready malt, floral. taste are clean easy lager - more bitter than most. not my bag, but solid.

Draft. Poured clear golden color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate earthy hop, yeast and malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Good above average beer.

Draft at the brewery, served in a curved pint glass. Pours a mostly clear bright gold with a finger of white head that settles into a ring and film while lacing the glass. Notes of straw, crackery and light cereal malts, mild spice, grass, and faint minerals. Light-bodied, with medium carbonation and a crisp, clean, lightly bitter mouthfeel. Has a nice crisp snap to it. Well-made helles. Not as many American brewers do one this well.
